qas.question: Led Zeppelin's first two albums both came out in what year?
What was the title of Deep Purple's hard rock 1970 album?
Black Sabbath's lyrics contained references to what cultural touchstones?

answers.text: occult and elements of Gothic horror

qas.question: What is the title of Black Sabbath's 1970 album?
What is one band directly influenced by Black Sabbath?
What acid rock album did Led Zeppelin record in 1970?
What group moved from hard rock to progressive rock?
Which group did not achieve a commercial breakthrough in 1970?
Who's lyrics contained elements that warned against the occult?
What year did Judas Priest produced the album Paranoid?

context: By the end of the decade a distinct genre of hard rock was emerging with bands like Led Zeppelin, who mixed the music of early rock bands with a more hard-edged form of blues rock and acid rock on their first two albums Led Zeppelin (<a0_0>1969<a0_0/>) and Led <b5_0>Zeppelin II<b5_0/> (1969), and <b6_0><b7_0>Deep Purple<b7_0/><b6_0/>, who began as a progressive rock group but achieved their commercial breakthrough with their fourth and distinctively heavier album, <a1_0>In Rock<a1_0/> (1970). Also significant was <b8_0>Black Sabbath<b8_0/>'s <a3_0>Paranoid<a3_0/> (<b9_0>1970<b9_0/>), which combined guitar riffs with dissonance and more explicit references to the <a2_0>occult and elements of Gothic horror<a2_0/>. All three of these bands have been seen as pivotal in the development of heavy metal, but where metal further accentuated the intensity of the music, with bands like <a4_0>Judas Priest<a4_0/> following Sabbath's lead into territory that was often "darker and more menacing", hard rock tended to continue to remain the more exuberant, good-time music.
